Docs.summary: Initializes a new

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string authenticationType) cil managed

Docs.param: will be used to when creating the for the AuthenticationType property.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new
Docs.remarks:
Defaults:
AddNonceToRequest: true.
AuthenticationMode: .
BackchannelTimeout: 1 minute.
Caption: .
ProtocolValidator: new .
RefreshOnIssuerKeyNotFound: true
ResponseMode:
ResponseType:
Scope: .
TokenValidationParameters: new with AuthenticationType = authenticationType.
UseTokenLifetime: true.
RedeemCode: false.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the Authority to use when making OpenIdConnect calls.

member this.Backchannel : System.Net.Http.HttpClient with get, set

Docs.summary: Used to communicate with the remote identity provider.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Owin::Security::ICertificateValidator ^ BackchannelCertificateValidator { Microsoft::Owin::Security::ICertificateValidator ^ get(); void set(Microsoft::Owin::Security::ICertificateValidator ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the a pinned certificate validator to use to validate the endpoints used when retrieving metadata.
Docs.remarks: If this property is null then the default certificate checks are performed, validating the subject name and if the signing chain is a trusted party.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Net::Http::HttpMessageHandler ^ BackchannelHttpHandler { System::Net::Http::HttpMessageHandler ^ get(); void set(System::Net::Http::HttpMessageHandler ^ value); };
member this.BackchannelHttpHandler : System.Net.Http.HttpMessageHandler with get, set

Docs.summary: The HttpMessageHandler used to retrieve metadata. This cannot be set at the same time as BackchannelCertificateValidator unless the value is a WebRequestHandler.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property TimeSpan BackchannelTimeout { TimeSpan get(); void set(TimeSpan value); };
member this.BackchannelTimeout : TimeSpan with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the timeout when using the backchannel to make an http call.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Owin::PathString CallbackPath { Microsoft::Owin::PathString get(); void set(Microsoft::Owin::PathString value); };
member this.CallbackPath : Microsoft.Owin.PathString with get, set

Docs.summary: An optional constrained path on which to process the authentication callback. If not provided and RedirectUri is available, this value will be generated from RedirectUri.
Docs.remarks: If you set this value, then the will only listen for posts at this address. If the IdentityProvider does not post to this address, you may end up in a 401 -> IdentityProvider -> Client -> 401 -> ...

Docs.summary: Get or sets the text that the user can display on a sign in user interface.

Docs.summary: Configuration provided directly by the developer. If provided, then MetadataAddress and the Backchannel properties will not be used. This information should not be updated during request processing.

Docs.summary: When set to true the authorization code will be redeemed for tokens at the token endpoint. This property is set to false by default.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool RefreshOnIssuerKeyNotFound { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.RefreshOnIssuerKeyNotFound : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets if a metadata refresh should be attempted after a SecurityTokenSignatureKeyNotFoundException. This allows for automatic recovery in the event of a signature key rollover. This is enabled by default.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool RequireHttpsMetadata { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.RequireHttpsMetadata : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets if HTTPS is required for the metadata address or authority. The default is true. This should be disabled only in development environments.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool UseTokenLifetime { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.UseTokenLifetime : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Indicates that the authentication session lifetime (e.g. cookies) should match that of the authentication token. If the token does not provide lifetime information then normal session lifetimes will be used. This is enabled by default.
